distribution.name: archive.zip
distribution.description: Archive containing all the contents of the Toulouse public library loans dataset dataset

distribution.name: toulouse_public_library_loans.csv
distribution.description:
### File format & encoding - Format: Semicolon-Separated Values (CSV) - Field separator: `;` (semicolon) - Encoding: UTF-8 (no BOM) - Line endings: Unix-style (LF) - Quote character: " (double-quote) where needed ### Column schema | **Column Name** | **Type** | **Description** | **Notes** | |--------------------|------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------| | **year** | integer | Calendar year for the loan count. | Four-digit year (e.g., 2019). | | **nb_loans** | integer | Number of loans recorded for that item in the given year. | Non-negative integer. | | **title** | string | Bibliographic title of the item. | Unicode text; preserve casing and diacritics. | | **author** | string | Creator or primary contributor. | "Last name, First name" or another cataloging form. | | **publisher** | string | Publication/production statement (publisher, place, year). | Free-form bibliographic note. | | **classification** | string | Local/collection classification code. | Library classification code (e.g., HARR). | | **library** | string | Library name | Short code, uppercase (e.g., CABANIS). | | **spine_label** | string | Printed spine label or call number used for shelving. | Free-form (may include slashes, numbers).| | **audience** | string | Intended audience code. | Uppercase singe or double letters. A (adults), E (Enfants, for kids), BB (under 5 y.o.). | | **media_subtype** | string | Subtype of the physical/virtual medium. | e.g., DVD, CD.. | | **media_type** | string | High-level media type. | e.g., films (for movies), cds (for music), imprimes (for prints); kept lowercase. | - Empty values will appear either like `;;` or `;-;` in the dataset. ### Sample header & row ```csv year;nb_loans;title;author;publisher;classification;library;spine_label;audience;media_subtype;media_type 2019;263;Harry Potter et la chambre des secrets;Columbus, Chris;Paris : Warner Home Video, 2003.;HARR;CABANIS;F HARR /2;E;;films ``` ## Controlled values | **Column Name** | **Possibilities** | |---------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **year** | from *2011* to *2024* (v2) | | **library** | `CABANIS`, `EMP`, `COL`, `CYP`, `MGM`, `FAB`, `PRA`, `PERIGORD`, `EXU` | | **audience** | `A`, `E`, or `BB` | | **media_subtype** | - `ALB`: Albums
- `BD`: Comic books
- `BRA`: Braille books
- `CD`: Audio CDs
- `CDVDROM`: CD-ROM and DVD-ROM
- `CONTE`: Tales
- `DVD`: DVD
- `DVDCONCERT`: Concert DVD
- `DVDDOC`: Documentary DVD
- `DVDFIC`: Fiction DVD
- `LANGETR`: Books in original language
- `LIV`: Books
- `LIVCD`: Books with audio CD
- `LIVCDVDR`: Books with CD/DVD ROM
- `LIVDOC`: Documentary books
- `LV`: Works for visually impaired
- `METLAN`: Language methods
- `PART`: Sheet music
- `PERIO`: Periodical publication
- `POL`: Detective novels
- `ROM`: Novels
- `SF`: Science fiction novels
- `TE`: Recorded texts | | **media_type** | `imprimes`, `films`, or `cds` |

A (adults), E (Enfants, for kids), BB (under 5 y.o.). | | **media_subtype** | string | Subtype of the physical/virtual medium. | e.g., DVD, CD.. | | **media_type** | string | High-level media type. | e.g., films (for movies), cds (for music), imprimes (for prints); kept lowercase. | - Empty values will appear either like `;;` or `;-;` in the dataset. ### Sample header & row ```csv year;nb_loans;title;author;publisher;classification;library;spine_label;audience;media_subtype;media_type 2019;263;Harry Potter et la chambre des secrets;Columbus, Chris;Paris : Warner Home Video, 2003.;HARR;CABANIS;F HARR /2;E;;films ``` ## Controlled values | **Column Name** | **Possibilities** | |---------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **year** | from *2011* to *2024* (v2) | | **library** | `CABANIS`, `EMP`, `COL`, `CYP`, `MGM`, `FAB`, `PRA`, `PERIGORD`, `EXU` | | **audience** | `A`, `E`, or `BB` | | **media_subtype** | - `ALB`: Albums

- `TE`: Recorded texts | | **media_type** | `imprimes`, `films`, or `cds` |

keywords: subject > arts and entertainment > movies and tv shows
name: Toulouse public library loans dataset
description:
# The toulouse public library loans dataset *This CSV dataset records annual circulation statistics and bibliographic metadata for prints films in the Toulouse public library collection. It is intended for analysis of lending trends, collection management, patron behavior, and media-use research.* ![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F27942110%2F31c778ffeaaddab9e5a7aaafa9070a3e%2Fbibliothque_toulouse_intrieur.jpg?generation=1760140559752887&alt=media)
*To the moons. Médiathèque José Cabanis, Tolosa.* ## Genesis >Thanks to an active open data policy, we're lucky to be provided with yearly lists of the 500 most borrowed items in Books, Movies and Music categories since 2011. This dataset is a merged and cleaned version of the 3 original datasets available per category on the [Toulouse metropolis open data portal](https://data.toulouse-metropole.fr/explore/?q=m%C3%A9diath%C3%A8que+top+500). ## Key attributes - Year of the lending count - Number of loans that year - Title publishing information - Classification and shelving information - Owning library and spine label - Intended audience and media type/subtype **Typical use cases:** circulation analytics, demand-driven acquisitions, shelf-planning, retrospective collection assessment, visualization of temporal loan patterns. ### Field-by-field details - **year** - What: calendar year for the loan tally. - Why: time-series analysis and trend detection. - Validation: integer, 4 digits, reasonable range (e.g., 2011–current year). - **nb_loans** - What: total number of recorded loans for that item in that year. - Why: measure of item demand and circulation. - Validation: non-negative integer. - **title** - What: bibliographic title as stored in the catalog. - Why: identification and grouping of editions/works. - Validation: non-empty Unicode string. - **author** - What: primary creator (for films: director). - Why: attribution, creator-based analytics. - Validation: cataloging form; Name and surname are comma separated. - **publisher** - What: publication/production statement (place, producer, year). - Why: disambiguation of editions/formats. - Validation: free text. - **classification** - What: local classification, supposed to be Dewey class. - Why: collection-level grouping and analytics. - Validation: short code -not consistent. - **library** - What: owning library. - Why: cross-branch comparison of circulation. - Validation: controlled short code, uppercase. - **spine_label** - What: printed call number or spine label used on the physical item. - Why: linking catalog records to physical shelving and signage. - Validation: may contain spaces, slashes, numbers. - **audience** - What: intended audience code. - Why: filtering by target patron group. - Validation: single-letter or double letters codes (E, A, BB). - **media_subtype** - What: more specific medium information (e.g., DVD). - Why: format-based circulation comparisons. - Validation: Controlled vocabulary, uppercase. - **media_type** - What: broad media class (films, books, audio, etc.). - Why: high-level aggregation and reporting. - Validation: controlled lowercase values. Details are available in these [notes](https://data.toulouse-metropole.fr/api/datasets/1.0/top-500-des-cds-les-plus-empruntes-a-la-bibliotheque-de-toulouse/attachments/top_500_des_cds_les_plus_a_la_bibliotheque_de_toulouse_txt/) (french) ## Usage examples 1. Total loans per year — Aggregate `nb_loans` by `year` to see annual circulation trends. ```python # Group by year and sum the number of loans total_loans_per_year = df.groupby('year')['nb_loans'].sum().reset_index() print(total_loans_per_year) ``` 2. Most-loaned films at a branch — Filter by `library`, group by `title`, sum `nb_loans`, sort descending. ```python branch_code = 'CABANIS' # Example branch code # Filter by library, group by title, and sum nb_loans most_loaned_films = df[df['library'] == branch_code].groupby('title')['nb_loans'].sum().reset_index() # Sort by nb_loans in descending order most_loaned_films = most_loaned_films.sort_values(by='nb_loans', ascending=False) print(most_loaned_films) ``` 3. **Tip:** - Some items might occur in several different medias/editions — For example, group by `media_subtype` (e.g., DVD) to compare lending counts. - But careful some items share the **same title** but are distinct (example: there are different Alice in Wonderland movies..). ### Validation tips - Ensure semicolon delimiter is preserved when importing (specify `delimiter=';'`). - For safety, normalize `publisher` and `author` strings for cross-year matching. ## Further details An example exploratory data analysis will be provided soon. ## Reproducibility Data processing details dealing with flaws present the original datasets (mojibake, data misalignment) are available on a [jupyter notebook](https://github.com/brooks-code/toulouse-biblio-chronicle). ## Versioning & changelog - v1 – October 2025 – Initial release - v2 – October 2025 – Updated release (added 2024 data and translated headers to english) ## License Licensed under the [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/public-domain/cc0/) license.
